===Police Brutality===
===Police Brutality===
â
[[Khaled Mohamed Saeed]] died under disputed circumstances in the [[Sidi Gaber]] area of [[Alexandria]] on June 6, 2010<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100614/FOREIGN/706139877/1011|title=Anger on the streets of Cairo|publisher=[[The National (Abu Dhabi)]]|date=2010-06-13|accessdate=2010-07-13}}</ref>. Multiple witnesses have testified that Saeed was beaten to death by the police,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/anger-alexandria-we%E2%80%99re-afraid-our-own-government|title=Anger in Alexandria: 'Weâre afraid of our own government' |publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2010-06-25|accessdate=2010-07-13}}</ref>
+
{{see also|Khaled Mohamed Saeed}}
  +
'''Khaled Mohamed Saeed''' died under disputed circumstances in the [[Sidi Gaber]] area of [[Alexandria]] on June 6, 2010<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100614/FOREIGN/706139877/1011|title=Anger on the streets of Cairo|publisher=[[The National (Abu Dhabi)]]|date=2010-06-13|accessdate=2010-07-13}}</ref>. Multiple witnesses have testified that Saeed was beaten to death by the police,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/anger-alexandria-we%E2%80%99re-afraid-our-own-government|title=Anger in Alexandria: 'Weâre afraid of our own government' |publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2010-06-25|accessdate=2010-07-13}}</ref>
On 25 June [[Mohamed ElBaradei]], former head of the [[International Atomic Energy Agency]], led a rally in Alexandria against alleged abuses by the police and visited Saeed's family to offer condolences.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/06/201062642955204618.html|title=ElBaradei leads anti-torture rally|publisher=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=2010-06-26|accessdate=2010-07-13}}</ref>
On 25 June [[Mohamed ElBaradei]], former head of the [[International Atomic Energy Agency]], led a rally in Alexandria against alleged abuses by the police and visited Saeed's family to offer condolences.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2010/06/201062642955204618.html|title=ElBaradei leads anti-torture rally|publisher=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=2010-06-26|accessdate=2010-07-13}}</ref>
